metadata.title: FedRAMP System Security Plan (SSP)

roles.title: FedRAMP Program Management Office
roles.description: The FedRAMP PMO resides within GSA and supports agencies and cloud service providers through the FedRAMP authorization process and maintains a secure repository of FedRAMP authorizations to enable reuse of security packages.

roles.title: FedRAMP Program Management Office
roles.description: Members of the JAB include the chief information officers (CIOs) from the Department of Defense, Department of Homeland Security, and General Services Administration. The JAB serves as the primary governance and decision-making body for FedRAMP.

roles.title: Prepared By
roles.description: The organization that prepared this SSP. If developed in-house, this is the CSP itself.

roles.title: Prepared For
roles.description: The organization for which this SSP was prepared. Typically the CSP.

roles.title: System Security Plan Approval
roles.description: The individual or individuals accountable for the accuracy of this SSP.

roles.title: Information System Owner
roles.description: The individual within the CSP who is ultimately accountable for everything related to this system.

roles.title: Authorizing Official
roles.description: The individual or individuals who must grant this system an authorization to operate.

roles.title: Authorizing Official's Point of Contact
roles.description: The individual representing the authorizing official.

roles.title: Information System Management Point of Contact (POC)
roles.description: The highest level manager who responsible for system operation on behalf of the System Owner.

roles.title: Information System Technical Point of Contact
roles.description: The individual or individuals leading the technical operation of the system.

roles.title: General Point of Contact (POC)
roles.description: A general point of contact for the system, designated by the system owner.

roles.title: System Information System Security Officer (or Equivalent)
roles.description: The individual accountable for the security posture of the system on behalf of the system owner.

roles.title: Privacy Official's Point of Contact
roles.description: The individual responsible for the privacy threshold analysis and if necessary the privacy impact assessment.

roles.title: Owner of an inventory item within the system.
Administrative responsibility an inventory item within the system.
ICA POC (Local)
roles.description: The point of contact for an interconnection on behalf of this system.
roles.remarks: Remove this role if there are no ICAs.

roles.title: ICA POC (Remote)
roles.description: The point of contact for an interconnection on behalf of this external system to which this system connects.
roles.remarks: Remove this role if there are no ICAs.

roles.title: ICA Signatory (Local)
roles.description: Responsible for signing an interconnection security agreement on behalf of this system.
roles.remarks: Remove this role if there are no ICAs.

roles.title: ICA Signatory (Remote)
roles.description: Responsible for signing an interconnection security agreement on behalf of the external system to which this system connects.
roles.remarks: Remove this role if there are no ICAs.

roles.title: Consultant
roles.description: Any consultants involved with developing or maintaining this content.

roles.title: Customer
roles.description: Represents any customers of this system as may be necessary for assigning customer responsibility.

roles.title: [SAMPLE]Unix Administrator
roles.description: This is a sample role.

roles.title: [SAMPLE]Client Administrator
roles.description: This is a sample role.

locations.title: CSP HQ
locations.remarks: There must be one location identifying the CSP's primary business address, such as the CSP's HQ, or the address of the system owner's primary business location.

locations.title: Primary Data Center
locations.remarks:
There must be one location for each data center.
There must be at least two data center locations.
For a data center, briefly summarize the components at this location.
All data centers must have a "type" property with a value of "data-center".
The type property must also have a class of "primary" or "alternate".

locations.title: Secondary Data Center
locations.remarks:
There must be one location for each data center.
There must be at least two data center locations.
For a data center, briefly summarize the components at this location.
All data centers must have a "type" property with a value of "data-center".
The type property must also have a class of "primary" or "alternate".

parties.name: Cloud Service Provider (CSP) Name
parties.remarks: Replace sample CSP information. CSP information must be present and associated with the "cloud-service-provider" role via responsible-party.

parties.name: Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program: Program Management Office
parties.remarks:
This party entry must be present in a FedRAMP SSP.
The uuid may be different; however, the uuid must be associated with the "fedramp-pmo" role in the responsible-party assemblies.

parties.name: Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program: Joint Authorization Board
parties.remarks:
This party entry must be present in a FedRAMP SSP.
The uuid may be different; however, the uuid must be associated with the "fedramp-jab" role in the responsible-party assemblies.

parties.name: External Organization
parties.remarks: Generic placeholder for any external organization.

parties.name: Agency Name
parties.remarks: Generic placeholder for an authorizing agency.

metadata.remarks:
This OSCAL-based FedRAMP SSP Template can be used for the FedRAMP Low, Moderate, and High baselines.
Guidance for OSCAL-based FedRAMP Tailored Low Impact - Software as a Service (LI-SaaS) content has not yet been developed.

import-profile.remarks:
This example points to the FedRAMP Rev 5 Moderate baseline that is part of the official FedRAMP 1.0.4 release.
Must adjust accordingly for applicable baseline and revision.

control-implementation.description:
Appendix A - FedRAMP SSP Rev5 Template
This description field is required by OSCAL.
FedRAMP does not require any specific information here.

props.remarks: Describe the plan to complete the implementation.
props.name: implementation-status

resources.title: Resolution Resource
resources.remarks: This "resolution resource" is used by FedRAMP as a local, authoritative indicator of what version SSP (rev 4 or rev 5) this OSCAL document is for.

FedRAMP is formulating guidelines for handling digital/electronic signatures in OSCAL, and welcome feedback on solutions. For now, FedRAMP recommends one of the following:
  • Render the OSCAL SSP content as a PDF that is digitally signed and attached.
  • Render the OSCAL SSP content as a printed page that is physically signed, scanned, and attached.
If your organization prefers another approach, please seek prior approval from the FedRAMP PMO.

resources.title: FedRAMP Applicable Laws and Regulations
resources.remarks: Must be present in a FedRAMP SAP.

resources.title: FedRAMP Master Acronym and Glossary
resources.remarks: Must be present in a FedRAMP SSP.

resources.title: FedRAMP Logo
resources.remarks: Must be present in a FedRAMP SSP.

resources.title: CSP Logo
resources.remarks: May use rlink with a relative path, or embedded as base64. FedRAMP prefers base64 for images and diagrams. Images must be in sufficient resolution to read all detail when rendered in a browser via HTML5.

resources.title: 3PAO Logo
resources.remarks: May use rlink with a relative path, or embedded as base64. FedRAMP prefers base64 for images and diagrams. Images must be in sufficient resolution to read all detail when rendered in a browser via HTML5.

resources.title: Boundary Diagram
resources.remarks: Section 8.1, Figure 8-1 Authorization Boundary Diagram (graphic) This should be referenced in the system-characteristics/authorization-boundary/diagram/link/@href flag using a value of "#d2eb3c18-6754-4e3a-a933-03d289e3fad5" May use rlink with a relative path, or embedded as base64. FedRAMP prefers base64 for images and diagrams. Images must be in sufficient resolution to read all detail when rendered in a browser via HTML5.

resources.title: Network Diagram
resources.remarks: Section 8.1, Figure 8-2 Network Diagram (graphic) This should be referenced in the system-characteristics/network-architecture/diagram/link/@href flag using a value of "#61081e81-850b-43c1-bf43-1ecbddcb9e7f" May use rlink with a relative path, or embedded as base64. FedRAMP prefers base64 for images and diagrams. Images must be in sufficient resolution to read all detail when rendered in a browser via HTML5.

resources.title: Data Flow Diagram
resources.remarks: Section 8.1, Figure 8-3 Data Flow Diagram (graphic) This should be referenced in the system-characteristics/data-flow/diagram/link/@href flag using a value of "#ac5d7535-f3b8-45d3-bf3b-735c82c64547" May use rlink with a relative path, or embedded as base64. FedRAMP prefers base64 for images and diagrams. Images must be in sufficient resolution to read all detail when rendered in a browser via HTML5.
